text:
- Hi, welcome to another episode
of "AWS Cloud Adventure."

I'm Gigi, and I'm an account
manager at Amazon Web Services.

In this episode, we
are going to talk about
Wallester's Cloud journey on AWS,
and we are going to touch on security

and compliance with Julian
Brand, CEO at Wallester UK.

Julian, thank you so much
for joining us today.
- Gigi, thank you.

It's an absolute pleasure
to be at AWS in Sweden.
- Can you introduce us to Wallester?
- So Wallester is a FinTech organization.
We provide innovative payment solutions

via a proprietary technology
platform that's cloud-native.
We operate in three countries.
Our foundation is in Estonia,
but we now have offices in France,
and also most recently in the UK.
We focus on doing what we do really well,
and we do two things.
We have two core products.

The first product that we have
is called Wallester Business,

and this is a highly
effective business expense

management tool where
companies can use our cards

to make their payments, to
understand their expenses,
and control their costs.

And secondly, we have
Wallester White-Label.

Wallester White-Label
is a turnkey solution

where we work with a
diverse range of partners.

Some of these are banks,
insurance companies,
non-financial organizations,
many different types of companies.

And using our turnkey solution
via a single Rest API,
they can integrate with Wallester

and within four weeks
start to issue VISA cards

branded in their own
name to their customers,
thereby enhancing their proposition,

but without having to do
any of the heavy lifting
of card issuing.

With those two products, we've
now achieved 31 partnerships

and 3,000, or over 3,000
corporate companies
using our Wallester Business solution.
And we're proud to say

that we almost have 1
million active cards.

Not quite a million yet,
but almost a million.

- Today, Wallester runs
fully on Amazon Web Services.

Why did you decide to
go for a cloud approach?
Why did you choose AWS?
- Yeah, that's a great question, Gigi.

When we started, we wanted
to go to market quickly.
Our platform was going to be central
to being able to launch our business,
but we needed secure, scalable,
and compliant infrastructure.

So, of course, we could
have tried to build
all of that ourselves,

but to build an in-house
data center is expensive,
it's complicated.

We would have to invest
very heavily upfront
to build that infrastructure.

But just as importantly, we
would have had to continue

to invest and bear the cost to
maintain that infrastructure.
We were fortunate that within our IT team

we had a number of experts
that had built on cloud before,

and also a number that
had worked with AWS before
and had a really positive experience.
As well as that, what we wanted to do

was work with a partner that
had a tried and tested solution

that was already working
with a number of very large

global organizations, so we
decided to work with AWS.

As I say, it wasn't such
a difficult decision.

In some ways, we see parallels
with our White-Label solution

because both of them are
very much turnkey solutions

where we take away all the
difficult stuff from our clients,
and clients can ask themselves,
"Why would we do this ourselves

when someone else we can
trust to do it better,
quicker and cheaper?"
That's what we see in AWS,

and we think that's what
our partners see in us
for our White-Label solution.

So now we've been up and
running for a number of years.
We are in the top five of VISA enablers,
so these are the companies within Europe

that VISA recommend other
companies to work with
when they want to launch a VISA program.

And as I said before, the
scalability that the technology
and the infrastructure has given us

has meant that we can
seamlessly grow to the point
where we now have almost a million cards,
active cards in operation.
- I love the analogy with AWS.

Wallester operates in a
highly regulated industry,
how AWS helped Wallester being compliant.

- You're right, financial
services companies,

we absolutely operate in a
highly regulated environment.
It's absolutely essential
that we are compliant in every way,
including our infrastructure.

The cost of doing that
internally is really high.
You have to invest in expertise,
you have to invest in processes,

you have to invest in external
audits on an ongoing basis.
And it's quite a heavy cost to bear,
particularly in a startup organization.

But by working with
AWS, we had the benefit
that the solution already is aligned with,

if I remember correctly,
143 security standards
and certifications, including PCI DSS.

PCI DSS is the payment card
industry data security standard.

It's the thing that's the
fundamental prerequisite
for any card issuer.

So because we worked with
AWS, we were one of the first
PCI DSS Certified companies in Estonia,

and actually we were the first
company that was approved
by the Estonian regulator, the FSA,
that was operating in a finance cloud.

- Julian, can you tell us
more about your successes
during the last two years?

- Sure, and there have
been lots of success

and lots of growth because
we now have an infrastructure

and a platform that's
scalable and that's secure.
We've been able to conceive, develop,
and launch a diverse range of new programs
with our White-Label partners.
And we've also been able to design
and launch Wallester Business,
the expense management solution.

In terms of numbers,
what that's meant is that

we've been able to grow our
revenue by a multiple of two.
We've been able to grow our transactions
by a multiple of three.

And you can only cope with a
higher volume of transactions
if you have a system that's scalable.

And we've been able to
importantly grow our customer base
by a multiple of four,
and that growth has enabled us
to invest more in our business.

So much so that we've increased
the size of our headcount
by 67% in the last 12 months.

And we've been able to
launch in two new countries,
so France last year and the UK this year,
which gives us a wider footprint
and more access to our clients,
more ability to grow our business.
We've had many individual successes
with well-known partners.
Two that we are particularly proud of

was a partnership with
one of the world's largest
virtual asset service providers,
a company called KuCoin.

The integration with KuCoin
was particularly innovative
and complex from a technical perspective.

And then secondly, we
launched a White-Label program
with Latvijas Pasts.
It was the first partnership we had
with a government authority.

And what we really were
proud about there is that

government entities will
only deal with companies
that we trust, and we feel that the fact

that they were willing to work
with us was a real validation

of the trust that they
have in our organization,
but also in our technology.
- What's next for Wallester?
- So more success, more growth, hopefully.

You said that you like
the analogy with Amazon,
so I hope at some stage

there's an analogy on
success with Wallester.

We have a way to go in
terms of growth yet.

Really we intend to carry
on doing what we do,
to keep a very clear focus on what we do,
but also on what we don't do.

To continue to have a very much
product-driven organization.

To continue to innovate
and to simplify problems

for our customers so
that we deliver things
that our customers need,

that the market needs
that are genuinely valued,

and that, importantly, increase
the operational efficiency
of our partners and of our customers.

Personally, because I'm
CEO of Wallester UK,
I'm very focused in the next year
on building the UK organization

where we want to recruit
a very high quality team

of payment experts, and
secure a direct license
with the UK Financial Conduct Authority
so we have that in addition to our license
with the Estonian FSA.

So in summary, we want to
continue with our mission
of providing the best products

with the best features at
the lowest possible cost.
In some way, when we look at the future,

we try not to think about
where we want to get to
and how we want to get there,
and instead think about how far can we go.
Let's see.
- Julian, thank you so much for your time
and for sharing the Wallester story.

- Thank you, Gigi, it's
a pleasure to be here.

And it's a pleasure to
have AWS as a partner.
- To the viewers,

if you want to learn more
from a technical perspective,
we invite you to watch a technical episode
with Mohamed and Andre.
Thank you.
